items.title: What to do with one hour in Abu Dhabi #shorts #tourism #abudhabi
items.author: Bloomberg Television
items.content: Which Abu Dhabi spots should you make sure to hit with one hour left in the city? Mohamed Al Mubarak, chairman of Abu Dhabi's Department of Culture and Tourism and Aldar Properties, tells David Rubenstein on "Peer to Peer Conversations" https://trib.al/tbkyXFU

items.title: Live Coverage: US Payrolls Rise by 227,000 in November
items.author: Bloomberg Television
items.content: US job market returns to health with 227,000 nonfarm payrolls increase in November. Unemployment rate edges higher to 4.2%, with long-term joblessness at highest in almost three years. This is live coverage from "Bloomberg Surveillance."

items.title: Fed Will Be Comfortable Cutting Rates, El-Erian Says
items.author: Bloomberg Television
items.content:
Mohamed El-Erian, Bloomberg Opinion columnist and Queens' College president, says the US November jobs report will make the Federal Reserve feel comfortable in cutting interest rates by 25 basis points. He's on "Bloomberg Surveillance."
(El-Erian's opinions are his own.)
--------

items.title: Macron Seeks New Government; Marine Le Pen Interview | Bloomberg The Pulse 12/06
items.author: Bloomberg Television
items.content:
Emmanuel Macron met with key politicians Friday in an effort to cobble together a new administration, a day after the French president vowed to serve out the remainder of his term. Meanwhile National Rally leader Marine Le Pen sits down with Bloomberg's Francine Lacqua for an exclusive interview.

Today's guests: Hannah Peters, Sanlam Investments UK

Chapters:
00:00:00 - The Pulse with Francine Lacqua
00:11:15 - US jobs report due today, Market watch
00:16:18 - OPEC+ Update, market check
00:19:27 - Exclusive: Marine Le Pen, France National Rally Leader
00:34:12 - Direct line accepts Aviva's takeover offer
00:37:24 - Queen Maxima of the Netherlands

items.title: Su Says Unemployment Is Still Historically Low
items.author: Bloomberg Television
items.content:
The US unemployment rate edges higher to 4.2% in November, but Acting Labor Secretary Julie Su says the rate is still "historically low" and the economy is continuing to grow. She's on "Bloomberg Open Interest."

items.title: "Dr. Doom" says he's actually "Dr. Realist" #shorts #markets #inflation
items.author: Bloomberg Television
items.content: "Dr. Doom" or Nouriel Roubini, CEO at Roubini Macro Associates, pushes back against his nickname, saying he is more of a "Dr. Realist" and details upsides he sees in economic growth https://trib.al/68mmZXK

items.title: AI-Crypto Gig Adds to Glittering Resume for David Sacks
items.author: Bloomberg Television
items.content:
David Sacks' remarkable career as a venture investor and member of the so-called PayPal Mafia with Elon Musk is taking another turn with his embrace of Donald Trump and a new, part-time role as the first White House czar for AI and crypto issues, Bloomberg's Caroline Hyde says on "Bloomberg Open Interest." Sonali Basak's Wall Street Beat newsletter is published Friday.
--------

items.title: US TikTok Ban Upheld by Federal Appeals Court
items.author: Bloomberg Television
items.content:
TikTok’s Chinese parent company faces a ban in the US if it doesn’t meet a Jan. 19 deadline to sell the video-sharing app as a result of a federal appeals court ruling Friday. The three-judge panel upheld the US law. But this all comes into question with President-elect Donald Trump being sworn in on January 20. Caroline Hyde reports.
--------

items.title: What Will the Fed Do After this Nov. Jobs Report?
items.author: Bloomberg Television
items.content:
The US job market returned to health last month after a storm- and strike-constrained October, with a solid advance in payrolls helping to temper concerns of a worsening slowdown in labor demand.

Nonfarm payrolls increased 227,000 last month following an upwardly revised 36,000 gain in October, according to Bureau of Labor Statistics figures released Friday. Since the figures have been choppy lately, economists are keeping an eye on payrolls growth over the past three months, which averaged 173,000.

The unemployment rate edged higher and wages rose by more than forecast.

For more on the data, Tom Keene and Paul Sweeney speak with Claudia Sahm, Chief Economist at New Century Advisors, and Sarah Wolfe, Senior Economist and Strategist at Morgan Stanley.
--------

items.title: US Adds 227,000 Jobs in November, Jobless Rate Increases
items.author: Bloomberg Television
items.content:
U.S. November payrolls increased 227,000 following an upwardly revised gain of 36,000 in October. The unemployment rate ticked up to 4.2% and average hourly earnings rose 0.4%. Michael McKee breaks down the numbers on Bloomberg Television.
--------

items.title: Rising unemployment keeps a Fed cut alive #shorts #fed #bloombergbrief
items.author: Bloomberg Television
items.content:
US November jobs report: Hiring rebounds, but rising unemployment keeps a Fed cut alive. Manus Cranny reports. 

Tune into "Bloomberg Brief" weekdays at 5 a.m. ET https://trib.al/278omIP

items.title: Fed's Goolsbee Says Labor Market Stable, Lower Rates Ahead
items.author: Bloomberg Television
items.content:
Federal Reserve Bank of Chicago President Austan Goolsbee says the labor market appears largely stable and expects rates will be “a fair bit lower” a year from now. Goolsbee speaks during a fireside chat as part of the Chicago Fed's Annual Economic Outlook Symposium.

Sign up for the Economics Daily newsletter to discover what's driving the global economy and what it means for policy makers, businesses, investors and you: https://bloom.bg/4535pfS

items.title: The calculation of ever-increasing hurricane risk #shorts #insurance #wallstreetweek #hurricane
items.author: Bloomberg Television
items.content: 2024 was the third costliest hurricane season in US history, and ever-increasing risks are driving up insurance costs. Watch "Wall Street Week" with David Westin Fridays at 6 p.m. ET https://trib.al/vvFkzLW

items.title: Hiring Rebounds, But US Jobless Rate Ticks Up | Bloomberg Surveillance | December 6, 2024
items.author: Bloomberg Television
items.content:
Bloomberg Surveillance hosted by Tom Keene and Paul Sweeney
December 6, 2024

Featuring:
•  Claudia Sahm, Chief Economist at New Century Advisors, Sarah Wolfe, Senior Economist at Morgan Stanley, Kathy Jones, Chief Fixed Income Strategist at Charles Schwab, and Lori Calvasina, Head of US Equity Strategy at RBC Capital Markets, break down the November nonfarm payrolls report
•  Alan S. Blinder, professor of economics at Princeton University and former Federal Reserve Vice Chairman, reacts to the latest jobs report and offers his take on America's socioeconomic path under the incoming Trump administration 
•  Stephen Carroll, host of Daybreak Europe on Bloomberg Radio, reports on French President Emmanuel Macron's efforts to form a new government after Prime Minister Michel Barnier was ousted in a no-confidence vote
